Detailed Description

SG_Callbacks hold 2 call backs to the outside world. The first is meant to be called when objects are replicated. And allows the outside world to synchronize external objects with replicated nodes and their children. The second is called when a node is destroyed and again is their for synchronization purposes These callbacks may both be NULL. The efficacy of this approach has not been proved some alternatives might be to perform all replication and destruction externally. To define a class interface rather than a simple function call back so that replication information can be transmitted from parent->child.
